unnormalised: ## Flash Sales: Blink and You Miss Out (And Your Daadi Screams)
normalised: ## Flash Sales: Blink and You Miss Out (And Your Daadi Screams)

unnormalised: Okay, let's be real. Flash sales. They're the shopping equivalent of a rickshaw ride through Chandni Chowk during Diwali: chaotic, exhilarating, and you’re probably going to lose your chapal in the process.
normalised: Okay, let's be real. Flash sales. They're the shopping equivalent of a rickshaw ride through Chandni Chowk during Diwali: chaotic, exhilarating, and you’re probably going to lose your chapal in the process.

unnormalised: You see that notification pop up: "Super Flash Sale! 80% OFF!" Your heart does a little bhangra dance. You think, "Finally, I can get that 5000 sq ft Jodha Akbar-esque lehenga I've been eyeing, at just Rs. 500!"
normalised: You see that notification pop up: "Super Flash Sale! eighty percent O F F!" Your heart does a little bhangra dance. You think, "Finally, I can get that five thousand square feet Jodha Akbar-esque lehenga I've been eyeing, at just rupees five hundred!"

unnormalised: But then reality hits you harder than a Delhi summer sun. By the time you click the link, everything's already "Out of Stock." Gone. Vanished. Poof! Like jalebis at a Sharma family wedding.
normalised: But then reality hits you harder than a Delhi summer sun. By the time you click the link, everything's already "Out of Stock." Gone. Vanished. Poof! Like jalebis at a Sharma family wedding.

unnormalised: And then comes the existential dread. Was it even real? Did anyone actually *get* anything? Or is it just a marketing ploy designed to make us feel inadequate and force us to buy that slightly-less-discounted kurta instead?
normalised: And then comes the existential dread. Was it even real? Did anyone actually *get* anything? Or is it just a marketing ploy designed to make us feel inadequate and force us to buy that slightly-less-discounted kurta instead?

unnormalised: My own personal experience with flash sales is usually this: I spend 3 hours refreshing the page, fighting with my slow internet connection (thanks, Airtel!), and end up accidentally ordering 3 left shoes and a Dr. Ambedkar poster. Which, okay, the poster is cool, but the shoes are useless.

unnormalised: It's like trying to catch the last local train from Churchgate during rush hour. You elbow your way through, sweat profusely, maybe even lose a button or two, and then realize you're on the wrong platform. And then your Daadi calls, asking why you haven't visited in 2 months and suddenly everything feels worse.

unnormalised: So, the next time you see a flash sale, take a deep breath, maybe meditate a little (yoga helps, I swear), and remember: It's just stuff. You don’t *need* that hand-embroidered Pashmina shawl with the face of Rajinikanth. Probably. Unless, of course, it's *really* cheap. Then, fight on, fellow shopper! May the odds be ever in your favor. Just don't blame me when you end up with 10 kg of tamarind candy you didn't order.
